title: Rutgers’ Ron Harper Jr. enters name in 2021 NBA Draft
body: Rutgers guard Ron Harper Jr. (24) smiles after a Scarlet Knights 3-pointer late in the second half of an NCAA college basketball game against the Michigan State Spartans on Thursday, Jan. 28, 2021, in Piscataway, N.J. Rutgers won, 67-37. junior forward announced his plans to submit his name for the 2021 NBA Draft and go through the NBA’s evaluation process while maintaining his college eligibility in an Instagram post Friday.The NBA Combine takes place from Monday, June 21 to Sunday, June 27. Early entrants like Harper have until Monday, July 19, to pull their name out of consideration. The 2021 NBA Draft takes place on Thursday, July 29.Harper showed NBA-level skill early in the 2020-21 season, playing at an through the first month of the season. He scored at least 20 points in five of his first seven games, averaging 23.4 points on 61.7% shooting and a 50% clip on three-pointers, along with 7.1 rebounds and 2.1 assists per game.After tweaking his ankle -- an injury that caused him to miss  -- his form dipped significantly. Harper has hit the 20-point mark just twice in his past 20 appearances since the injury, averaging 11.9 points on 50% shooting, including a 21.1% clip on threes, missing 75 of his last 92 3-point attempts of the season.Despite his recent struggles, Harper has the .
